tournament.name: 2015 New Year Cake Cup Annual Tournament (Shanghai)

decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy and resources while maintaining card advantage through card draw and filtering. Using a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Tasigur, the Golden Fang serves as a versatile commander that can provide card advantage and recursion. The deck also includes powerful spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Demonic Tutor to find key cards when needed. By effectively managing resources and making efficient plays, the deck seeks to outlast opponents and win through attrition and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, card draw, and hand disruption. Tasigur, the Golden Fang serves as the commander, providing card advantage and a strong presence on the board. The deck includes a variety of versatile spells like Counterspell, Hero's Downfall, and Damnation to deal with threats, along with powerful draw spells such as Ancestral Vision and Dig Through Time. Hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach help disrupt opponents' strategies, while creatures like Snapcaster Mage provide additional value by recasting spells from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' plans and control the game until Tasigur can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on utilizing Animar, Soul of Elements as the commander to ramp up quickly and efficiently to combo off and win the game. The key strategy involves casting creatures with colorless mana to reduce Animar's cost, allowing for explosive plays. The deck includes a variety of combo pieces such as Aluren, Ancestral Statue, and Peregrine Drake to generate infinite mana and win conditions like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes powerful card draw engines like Sylvan Library and Skullclamp to maintain consistency and find key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a strong emphasis on efficient creature threats and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. With cards like Jenara, Asura of War, True-Name Nemesis, and Primeval Titan, the deck aims to quickly establish a commanding board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of utility creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Eternal Witness, as well as versatile spells like Swords to Plowshares and Bant Charm to deal with threats and protect its own creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and strategic disruption to secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to utilize Alesha, Who Smiles at Death's ability to bring back powerful creatures with a power of 2 or less from the graveyard. By including a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. With cards like Lightning Bolt, Swords to Plowshares, and Thoughtseize, the deck can deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine can provide further advantages in combat. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to secure a victory in one-on-one matches.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's resources and board state while building up your own artifact-based engine. By using Daretti, Scrap Savant as the commander, the deck focuses on utilizing artifacts such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Myr Battlesphere to generate value and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Winter Orb, Trinisphere, and Defense Grid further adds to the control aspect of the deck, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their game plan effectively. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of resource denial and powerful artifact synergies.

The main focus of this Narset, Enlightened Master deck is to control the game through powerful spells and board manipulation. It includes a variety of control elements such as counterspells like Cryptic Command, artifact removal like Wear/Tear, and board wipes like Wrath of God. The deck also utilizes cards like Winter Orb and Armageddon to disrupt opponents' resources and slow down the game. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Tezzeret the Seeker and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide card advantage and control the battlefield. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish control early on and use powerful spells to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

The deck revolves around using control elements to disrupt your opponent's strategy while ramping up your own resources. Narset, Enlightened Master serves as the commander to provide a powerful ability when attacking and casting spells without paying their mana cost. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, board wipes, and card draw to control the game and outvalue your opponent. It also includes artifact ramp to accelerate your mana production and access to powerful planeswalkers like Tezzeret the Seeker and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to establish board control, disrupt your opponent's game plan, and win through incremental advantage and powerful spells.
